name: antsAtroposN4.sh
author: ANTs Developers
description: Iterates between N4 <-> Atropos to improve segmentation results.

inputs.name: Image Dimension
inputs.description: 2 or 3, for 2- or 3-dimensional image.

inputs.name: Input Image
inputs.description: Anatomical image, typically T1. If more than one anatomical image is specified, subsequent images are also used during the segmentation process.

inputs.name: Mask Image
inputs.description: Binary mask defining the region of interest.

inputs.name: Number of Segmentation Classes
inputs.description: Number of classes defining the segmentation.

inputs.name: Output Prefix
inputs.description: The following images are created: {output_prefix}N4Corrected.{output_suffix}, {output_prefix}Segmentation.{output_suffix}, {output_prefix}SegmentationPosteriors.{output_suffix}

inputs.name: Max. N4 <-> Atropos Iterations
inputs.description: Maximum number of (outer loop) iterations between N4 <-> Atropos (default = 15).

inputs.name: Max. Atropos Iterations
inputs.description: Maximum number of (inner loop) iterations in Atropos (default = 3).

inputs.name: Segmentation Priors
inputs.description: Prior probability images initializing the segmentation. Specified using c-style formatting, e.g. -p labelsPriors%02d.nii.gz. If this is not specified, k-means initialization is used instead.

inputs.name: Segmentation Priors
inputs.description: Prior probability images initializing the segmentation. Specified using c-style formatting, e.g. -p labelsPriors%02d.nii.gz. If this is not specified, k-means initialization is used instead.

inputs.name: Segmentation Priors Folder
inputs.description: Included so.

inputs.name: MRF
inputs.description: Specifies MRF prior (of the form '[ weight,neighborhood ]', e.g. '[ 0.1,1x1x1 ]' which is default).

inputs.name: Denoise Anatomical Images
inputs.description: Denoise anatomical images (1) or not (0) (default = 1).

inputs.name: Posterior Formulation
inputs.description: Posterior formulation and whether or not to use mixture model proportions. e.g 'Socrates[ 1 ]' (default) or 'Aristotle[ 1 ]'.  Choose the latter if you want to use the distance priors, see also the -l option for label propagation control (default = 'Socrates[ 1 ]').

inputs.name: Label Propagation
inputs.description:
Incorporate a distance prior into the 'Aristotle' posterior formulation. Should be of the form 'label[ lambda,boundaryProbability ]' where label is a value of 1,2,3,... denoting label ID. The label probability for anything outside the current label

  = boundaryProbability * exp( -lambda * distanceFromBoundary )

Intuitively, smaller lambda values will increase the spatial capture range of the distance prior. To apply to all label values, simply omit specifying the label, i.e. -l '[ lambda,boundaryProbability ]'.

inputs.name: Posterior Label for N4 Weight Mask
inputs.description: Which posterior probability image should be used to define the N4 weight mask. Can also specify multiple posteriors in which case the chosen posteriors are combined.

inputs.name: Image File Suffix
inputs.description: Any of the standard ITK IO formats e.g. nrrd, nii.gz (default), mhd.

inputs.name: Keep Temporary Files
inputs.description: Keep temporary files on disk (1) or delete them (0) (default = 0).

inputs.name: Use Random Seeding
inputs.description: Use random number generated from system clock in Atropos (default = 1).

inputs.name: Atropos Prior Segmentation Weight
inputs.description: Atropos spatial prior probability weight for the segmentation (default = 0.25).

inputs.name: N4 Convergence
inputs.description: Convergence parameters for N4, see '-c' option in N4BiasFieldCorrection (default = [50x50x50x50,0.0000001]).

inputs.name: N4 Shrink Factor
inputs.description: Shrink factor for N4 (default = 4).

inputs.name: N4 B-spline Parameters
inputs.description: N4 b-spline specification, see '-b' option in N4BiasFieldCorrection (default = [200,0,0,0]).

inputs.name: Atropos ICM
inputs.description: ICM parameters for segmentation, see '-g' option in Atropos (default = [1,1]).

inputs.name: Atropos Use Euclidean Distance
inputs.description: Use euclidean distances in distance prior formulation (1) or not (0), see Atropos usage for details (default = 1).

inputs.name: Test / Debug Mode
inputs.description: If > 0, attempts to continue after errors.
